answers.answer: This sounds like typical hypoglycemic.  Do you eat something at least every two hours or drink something other than water every two hours?  Blood sugar drops even lower when under stress.  I find that cheese and crackers seems to pull me out of a hypoglycemic attack in about 20 minutes.  Otherwise, juice helps fast also.  Symptoms I get are dizziness, lightheadedness, shaking, feeling faint or like a seizure will happen, feeling like not in control of body, hard time focusing.  People actually can go into a coma or have seizures if the blood sugar is not addressed or dealt with.  The best way to prevent hypoglycemia is to increase protein.  Turkey is a good way to add extra protein.  Eat something every two hours.  Add vitamin B stress tabs if stress is the cause.   People and children who go for long periods of time without eating have a higher risk for diabetes.

question: The symptoms you have listed are literally the exact symptoms I have experienced in the past 6-8 months. I am a 20 year old male and have never once shied away from an opportunity to be outstanding. I have never thought about anxiety before this feeling occurred. What have you found out? Any medication for it? Any specific medical term for it?Again, I feel like you and I literally have the same 'ailment' whatever it may be. Your information was very helpful. If you have any information it would be greatly appreciatedThis discussion is related to/posts/show/879269.
title: Same thing
